div1.head: Letter from Ida E. Kissinger to James E. Peabody, February 4, 1927
div1.opener:
Feb. 4- 27 Andrews'
Indiana
James E. Peabody, Prof. Biology
Our Dear Friend.
div1.p:
You told us if at any
time we were in need.
to let you know. you
have been very kind
to us and many of
your friends, have done
lots for us this fall, now
this letter is to ask you
if you could assist us
in my financial part of
an Operation I am going to
to South Bend, Indiana, to
the clinic there, far fibroid
Tumor. The Dr. told me It
would cost me for Operation
$135, dollars. Then Room. Board
all come extra.

I have on hand. 3500 dollars
and if Its possible. you may,
write me at-

Mr Kissinger is almost,
Crazy over it - for two days'
last week could not stand
on his feet. he is very Nervious
and. all worked up over it -
hope you one well; and we
do hope for some help Its
awful to have to do this but
we dont know of any other
way.

Dear Mr Peabody I guess
we never will have a home
but we have give up hopeing
for anything my health is
so poorr. Since the 7th, of Sept.

With Kindest Regards;
to you all we are
div1.closer:
Respectfuly your Mrs John R Kissinger
John R. Kissinger I will give you any Reference
you would like as to this
Mrs. Kissinger
